intro: Sideroxylon gillettii, commonly known as the Gilbert's ironwood, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its dense, hard wood and evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by spherical fruits that split open to release seeds. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its unique characteristics, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
